title: Fontina Cheese Sauce
introduction: This Fontina Cheese Sauce, or Fonduta, is a rich, creamy delight often enjoyed at the Locanda di Felicin in Monforte d'Alba, Piedmont. Chef Giorgio Rocca presents this luxurious sauce in shallow plates topped with shaved truffles or drizzled over vegetables such as broccoli or asparagus. You might also want to try it on potato gnocchi for a delicious twist.
ingredients: ½ pound Fontina Valle d'Aosta, cut into ½-inch cubes
instructions: In a small saucepan, whisk together the egg yolks and cream.
Add the cheese and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth, about 2 minutes.
